title: Common virus is 'less prone to mutation' giving hope for vaccine development

title_detail.value: Common virus is 'less prone to mutation' giving hope for vaccine development

summary: One of the commonest causes of congenital disability, the Human Cytomegalovirus (HCMV), is less prone to mutation than previously thought, a finding which could help develop a successful vaccine.

summary_detail.value: One of the commonest causes of congenital disability, the Human Cytomegalovirus (HCMV), is less prone to mutation than previously thought, a finding which could help develop a successful vaccine.
